Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Partial infiltration, influenced by large effective cluster size and low anisotropy, leading to greater size-exclusion compared to other solvents.

Other Information.Additional Info: Low initial sorption (5-15%) that increased monotonically over 21 days. Predicted sorption fraction: 0.226. Average cluster Rmax: 32.1 Å. Cluster anisotropy (κ2): 0.268.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Partial infiltration, influenced by effective cluster size and low anisotropy.

Other Information.Additional Info: Moderate initial sorption (20-40%), dramatically increased at 3 days, then stabilized by day six. Predicted sorption fraction: 0.433. Average cluster Rmax: 22.2 Å. Cluster anisotropy (κ2): 0.241.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Partial infiltration, influenced by intermolecular hydrogen bonding leading to cluster formation.

Other Information.Additional Info: Low initial sorption (5-15%) that increased monotonically over 21 days. Predicted sorption fraction: 0.333. Average cluster Rmax: 28.0 Å. Cluster anisotropy (κ2): 0.366.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Significant infiltration due to high cluster anisotropy and relatively small cluster Rmax, allowing easier passage.

Other Information.Additional Info: Moderate initial sorption (20-40%), dramatically increased at 3 days, then stabilized by day six. Had the highest predicted sorption fraction: 0.618. Average cluster Rmax: 6.8 Å. Cluster anisotropy (κ2): 0.472.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Partial infiltration, influenced by cluster anisotropy and Rmax.

Other Information.Additional Info: Moderate initial sorption (20-40%), dramatically increased at 3 days, then stabilized by day six. Predicted sorption fraction: 0.447. Average cluster Rmax: 26.2 Å. Cluster anisotropy (κ2): 0.471.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Partial infiltration facilitated by molecular flexibility allowing effective size reduction to fit pores, despite large nominal size, and relatively low anisotropy.

Other Information.Additional Info: Larger initial sorption that remained stable over 21 days. Predicted sorption fraction: 0.504. Majority of its Rmax values (average 16.6 Å) fall within ZIF-8 pore aperture range. Cluster anisotropy (κ2): 0.261.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Significant infiltration due to high cluster anisotropy, allowing linear clusters to pass easily.

Other Information.Additional Info: Larger initial sorption that remained stable over 21 days. Had the highest predicted sorption fraction: 0.599. Average cluster Rmax: 15.1 Å. Cluster anisotropy (κ2): 0.523.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Partial infiltration, influenced by cluster properties.

Other Information.Additional Info: Moderate initial sorption (20-40%), dramatically increased at 3 days, then stabilized by day six. Predicted sorption fraction: 0.523. Average cluster Rmax: 16.3 Å. Cluster anisotropy (κ2): 0.365.

Sieving Mechanism: Molecular sieving influenced by effective solvent size and shape due to solvent clustering and molecular flexibility, demonstrating a departure from simple single-molecule size exclusion.

Experimental Validation.Method: Density measurements (He pycnometry), Atomistic molecular dynamics (MD) simulations
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Experimental sorption fraction values (average from day 6-21) ranged from 0.147 (GT) to 0.644 (DMI). Model fit to experimental data showed R2 = 0.76. Fitted ZIF-8 pore aperture size (Rc) = 5.76 ± 0.55 Å.

Other Information.Additional Info: Used as a sorbent material in Type 3 Porous Liquids (PLs). Infiltration of solvents into ZIF-8 pores indicates a kinetic limitation for solvent adsorption, leading to a time-dependent decrease in PL porosity.
